channel.title: briefUpdatesHealthOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesHealthOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Ciudades fracasan en reducir las muertes por accidentes de tránsito
item.description: Estas fatalidades han aumentado un 20% a lo largo de Estados Unidos con respecto a hace una década: de 32.744 en 2014 a 39.345 en 2024.

item.title: Clinics that provide abortion in Maine face an onslaught
item.description: Abortion is supported by three out of four Mainers, but a popular network of clinics that provides it alongside primary care is being shut out of Medi...

item.title: With 'Baby Botox,' young adults strive to keep wrinkles from ever forming
item.description: A growing number of 20-somethings are trying to freeze time with preventative Botox treatments. Here's what's behind the trend.

item.title: Dementia housing without locked wards? It's a small but growing movement
item.description: Some senior living communities are caring for people with dementia alongside other residents, not segregated behind locked doors.

item.title: Support your neighborhood scientist
item.description: By KIM BELLARD These are, it must be said, grim times for American science. Between the Trump budget cuts, the Trump attacks on leading research unive...

item.title: For clues on how to evade cancer, some scientists look to the bowhead whale
item.description: Where might we look for inspiration for new cancer therapies? Some researchers say the bowhead whale may offer clues.

item.title: El ICE puede estar en el hospital con un paciente bajo custodia. Pero los detenidos tienen derechos
item.description: Expertos legales explican que los agentes del ICE pueden estar en áreas públicas de un hospital y pueden acompañar a pacientes que ya están detenidos ...

item.title: FDA’s Plan To Boost Biosimilar Drugs Could Stall at the Patent Office
item.description: Drug industry officials and analysts praised the FDA’s plans to streamline regulation of “biosimilars,” which are cheaper alternatives to biologic dru...

item.title: Once a Patient’s in Custody, ICE Can Be at Hospital Bedsides — But Detainees Have Rights
item.description: Federal law allows Immigration and Customs Enforcement agents to guard detainees at health care facilities, but patients can ask to speak privately wi...

item.title: A red meat allergy caused by ticks killed a N.J. man. Here's what to know
item.description: Researchers say they believe they've documented the first known death from alpha-gal syndrome — a red meat allergy caused by tick bites.

item.title: Journalists Untangle Issues of Health Care Costs and Food Benefits
item.description: KFF Health News journalists made the rounds on national or local media recently to discuss topical stories. Here’s a collection of their appearances.

item.title: Sachin Jain–How do we do better?
